result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerek J Stys was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Faiure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Restitution in the amount of $7,500.00 payable to Roland Machinery Corporation; all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge; all applicable fees of supervision.  
If revoked, all to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owig is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant:  that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No contact with the victim or coactors named in the complaint.
Upon successful completion of probation including financial obligations, Court will consider motion for expungement.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Straight time. STAYED commencement until 7/24/2015 by 5:00 p.m.
With group associated with lakefront conserveration.

records.addlTxt: Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  mag
Defendant's motion for modification of judgment.
Filed by Attorney Laurence M. Moon, Notice Of Motion And Motion For Modification Of Judgment
Upon successful completion of probation (including financial obligations), Court will consider motion for expungement

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Kevin S.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 1 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.   

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.  Upon successful completion of probation (including financial obligations) Court will consider motion for expungement.

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 7 days condition time, STRAIGH TIME.  Court stayed commencement until 07/24/2015 by 5pm.
- 100 hours of community service with group associated with lakefront conservation.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with the victim or co-actors named in the complaint.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $7,500 payable to Roland Machinery Corporation; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Jerek J Stys in court with attorney Laurence M Moon.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to negotiations, Count 2 is dismissed and read in, as to Count 1:
Defendant waived constitutional rights and pled no contest and was examined as to his plea.  No contest plea questionnaire received and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information.   Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Jerek J Stys in court with attorney Laurence M Moon.  Thomas Potter for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case in court for plea and sentencing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

At the request of the defense, and without objection from the court or state, scheduling conference scheduled for 07/02/2015 at 8:30am is converted to a plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.

Defendant Jerek J Stys in court with attorney Laurence M Moon.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerek J Stys in court with attorney Laurence M Moon.  Thomas Potter for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Parties request more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jerek J Stys in court with attorney Laurence M Moon.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Detective Robert Michalski.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch *.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (3-20-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with 9006 S 5th Ave Oak Creek WI, Brian N., and Kyle O.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jerek J Stys in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES  QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/19/15 @ 1:30pm
